THE TWO SIDES OF MBO PARTNERS: THINGS MAY NOT ALWAYS BE WHAT THEY SEEM
For a variety of reasons this past year, I have begun to look differently at MBO Partners. Part of the reason is that I tend to be curious about “contingent workforce intermediation businesses” in general, and especially those that don’t seem to conform to the norm... Read More <http://www.staffingindustry.com/Research-Publications/Blogs/Andrew-Karpie-s-Blog/The-Two-Sides-of-MBO-Partners-Things-May-Not-Always-Be-What-They-Seem2>
RECENT RECLASSIFICATION CASES: THE 70,000 POUND GORILLA IN THE ROOM
I recently found myself in front of the TV unable to turn off King Kong. Not the jittery original version or the tedious high-tech bust from a few years ago, but that semi-appealing 70s melodrama... Read More <http://www.mboenterprise.com/blog/recent-reclassification-cases-70000-pound-gorilla-room>
THE STATE OF THE LABOR MARKET: 3 REVELATIONS
After speaking with leaders in the business community, self-employed workers and the heads of Federal agencies, I saw that there was more going on than what could be expressed in one sound bite... Read More <http://www.mboenterprise.com/blog/state-labor-market-3-revelations>
THE GREATEST MYTH OF INDEPENDENT CONSULTING
